page.title: 13PLAYING OUT AT HORNBY
page.content: In Hornby there are lots of different places we play in. One is a bridge over a beck. There are lots of trees round the beck. We enjoy trying to get across without using the bridge. There is also a tree in one field which has a branch that is bouncy we have rides on it we call it the Bouncy Branch. When we play cricket. We play it in Park Chase. We sometimes make secret dens. Sometimes we play hide and seek. In winter we find ice ponds and play Eskimos trying to catch seals. We get sticks and smash the ice. Sometimes we collect ladybirds and put them on slates.
